article.topic: Context is more important than prompts in SEO writing
article.writingAngle: 方法论转变 - 从 prompt-first 到 context-first 的实操指南

company.name: Semrush
company.coreBusiness: Semrush provides a comprehensive software platform for digital marketing professionals, offering tools for search engine optimization, paid advertising analysis, content marketing, competitive intelligence, and social media management.
company.valueProposition: An all-in-one digital marketing platform that enables marketers to analyze competitors, track search rankings, audit websites, and optimize content across multiple marketing channels.

audience.description: Marketing managers, small business owners with some experience, content managers, startup founders
audience.industry: Marketing managers, small business owners with some experience, content managers, startup founders

goals.primary: Improve marketing results; select right tools; understand competitive landscape; justify marketing investments
secondary: Translate data insights into actionable strategy

alreadyKnows: Basic SEO and digital marketing concepts
AI writing tools exist and can help with content creation
Prompts are used to instruct AI
needsToLearn: How to compare and select marketing tools
How to interpret and act on data
Best practices for their specific situation
Why context matters more than prompts in AI writing
How to shift from prompt-first to context-first workflows
Practical methods for providing rich context to AI

typicalQuestions: How to write better AI prompts
Why is my AI content generic

writingApproach.complexity: Moderate; can use industry terms with brief clarification
writingApproach.structure: Problem-solution format; comparison tables; numbered lists

do: Provide decision frameworks: 'When choosing between tools, consider these factors...'
Use comparison tables for quick evaluation
Offer concrete recommendations: 'For blogs targeting long-tail keywords...'
Connect tactics to business outcomes (traffic, leads, revenue)
Show before/after examples of prompt-first vs context-first approaches
Include practical voice-to-text and context-building techniques
dont: Over-explain basic concepts they already know
Present options without recommendations or guidance
Be preachy about why prompts are 'wrong'
Skip the practical how-to in favor of theory

userContext.situation: They've been using AI writing tools but getting mediocre, generic results. They've tried various prompt templates and 'perfect prompts' but still feel like something is missing. They may have heard that context matters but don't know how to operationalize this insight.
userContext.currentState: Frustrated with generic AI output despite trying different prompts. Spending too much time crafting prompts and not enough time on the actual content strategy. May be overwhelmed by prompt engineering advice.
userContext.desiredState: Understand the fundamental shift from prompt-first to context-first thinking. Have a practical workflow for providing rich context to AI. Get better AI writing output with less effort on prompt crafting.

searchIntent.coreQuestion: How do I shift from obsessing over prompts to providing rich context that actually improves my AI writing output?
implicitQuestions: What exactly is 'context' in AI writing and how is it different from prompts?
What practical methods can I use to provide context faster?
Why does context produce better results than carefully crafted prompts?
How do I use voice-to-text and other tools to share context efficiently?
What frameworks or techniques help structure context-giving?
searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can immediately apply the context-first approach to their next AI writing session, using voice-to-text or extended context-sharing to get noticeably better output without spending time on prompt engineering.

keyInsights: Everyone teaches prompts, but context beats prompts every time
Voice-to-text enables faster context sharing than typing
High fidelity transcription means you can just talk naturally
Frameworks still useful (challenge assumptions, ask clarifying questions, interview me)
The advice is simple: 'Just keep talking' - results speak for themselves
suggestedFrameworks: Ask me clarifying questions before you do anything
Interview me to help me hone this idea
userNotes.voiceToTextAdvantage: Allows sharing context faster than phone tapping or even typing; high fidelity means natural speech works

goldenInsights.insight: 87% of creators use AI, but only 13% get meaningful engagement - the difference is context, not prompts
Voice dictation is 3-4x faster than typing (150 WPM vs 40 WPM); just keep talking is the advice
Most agent failures are not model failures - they are context failures
Prompt templates are more magic ritual than useful - there is no single template that works

differentiation.primaryDifferentiator: Voice-to-text workflow as practical, fast context-sharing method combined with interactive techniques (Interview Me, Challenge Assumptions, Ask Clarifying Questions)

irreplicableInsights.insight: Voice-to-text is 3-4x faster; just keep talking works
87% vs 13% engagement gap shows context is the differentiator

avoidList: Being too technical/developer-focused like Anthropic article
Being too conceptual without actionable steps
Focusing only on what context IS without the practical HOW

data: No direct A/B test data on prompt-first vs context-first outcomes
Limited quantitative evidence on context engineering effectiveness
coverage: Voice-to-text workflow not covered by competitors

controversies: Some argue prompt engineering is still important, just evolving
Debate on whether bigger context windows help or hurt
research.coreThesis: Stop obsessing over the perfect prompt. The real unlock is giving AI rich context through natural conversation - speak your background, ask it to interview you, and just keep talking.

emphasize: Voice-to-text as practical method (strong data on speed)
Interactive techniques with exact example prompts
Simplicity of just keep talking approach
cautious: Claims about context engineering replacing prompt engineering (still debated)
Specific performance improvement numbers (limited direct evidence)

hookUsed.content: 87% 的内容创作者在用 AI 写作，但只有 13% 获得了有意义的参与度和商业结果

differentiationApplied.primaryDifferentiatorUsed: 语音输入作为核心方法，3-4倍速度优势，配合三个互动技巧（采访法、质疑法、澄清法）

irreplicableInsightsUsed.insight: 语音输入 3-4 倍速度 + 一直说下去
大多数失败是上下文失败（Anthropic）
提示词模板是魔法咒语（Mollick）

avoidedPatterns: 避免技术化/开发者视角
避免只讲是什么不讲怎么做
differentiationApplied.titleDifferentiation: 用中文口语化表达，聚焦实操而非理论概念

opinionsIncluded: H2-1: 给模型更好上下文比换更好模型有效
H2-2: 与其收藏提示词模板不如学会快速给上下文
H2-2: 提示词技巧价值在下降，上下文信息价值在上升
H2-3: 语音输入是被低估的生产力工具
H2-4: 多余信息是干扰不是加分项

strong: H2-3 三个方法（有数据支撑）
weak: H2-4 上下文质量部分（数据相对较少）
differentiated: H2-3 互动技巧（有示例提示词）
